remarks: Part of proof of Lemma E in [Crawley] p. 113.  Utility lemma showing ` F ` is a lattice element. ` F ` represents their f(r).  (Contributed by NM, 6-Jun-2012.)
statement:
cdleme1.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
cdleme1.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
cdleme1.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
cdleme1.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
cdleme1.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
cdleme1.u $e |- U = ( ( P .\/ Q ) ./\ W ) $.
cdleme1.f $e |- F = ( ( R .\/ U ) ./\ ( Q .\/ ( ( P .\/ R ) ./\ W ) ) ) $.
cdleme1.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
cdleme1b $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ ( P e. A /\ Q e. A /\ R e. A ) ) -> F e. B ) $.
